objects.name: Trigona Ransomware
objects.description:
In December 2022, Unit 42 researchers investigated an incident involving Trigona ransomware, a relatively new strain that security researchers first discovered in late October 2022. Although this blog will be discussing this newer variant, Unit 42 is aware that there was a previously-unnamed variant of Trigona found in the wild in early 2022. 

During the incident response engagement, Unit 42 discovered Trigona’s operator(s) obtained initial access to their target’s environment, conducted reconnaissance, transferred malware via remote monitoring and management (RMM) software, created new user accounts, and deployed ransomware.

Trigona’s ransom notes are unique; rather than the usual text file, they are instead presented in an HTML Application with embedded JavaScript containing unique campaign IDs and victim IDs. 

From the ransom notes, we discovered that Trigona operator(s) further intimidate victims by threatening double extortion: in addition to encrypting files in the victims’ system with a ._locked extension, the operator(s) claim to steal data. If victims do not pay the ransom demand, the operator(s) threaten to auction off the data. Trigona has a new name-and-shame extortion site that is, at the time of writing, available on the Surface Web.

Trigona has infrastructure and capability that overlaps with Crylock ransomware. Both operations share a specific email address for victim’s to contact. Also, there are similarities in the ransom note’s format and content.

objects.name: Trigona Ransomware
objects.description: By analyzing Trigona ransomware binaries and ransom notes obtained from VirusTotal, Unit 42 determined that Trigona was very active in December 2022, with at least 15 potential victims being compromised that month. Unit 42 identified two new Trigona ransom notes in January 2023 and two in February 2023. Thus far, the victims tend to be based in western countries and are in the industries of manufacturing, finance, construction, agriculture, marketing, and high technology.
